sanskrit_verse:
न तैः समयमन्विच्छेत्पुरुषो धर्ममाचरन् ।
व्यवहारो मिथस्तेषां विवाहः सदृशैः सह ॥ १०.५३॥
transliteration:
na taiḥ samayamanvicchet puruṣo dharmamācaran |
vyavahāro mithasteṣāṃ vivāhaḥ sadṛśaiḥ saha || 10.53||
sph_interpretive_translation: A man performing dharma shall not seek agreement from those who are not aligned in consciousness; mutual conduct and marriage must be with those of equal capacity and alignment.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority arises from consciousness alignment, not social position
Causation is determined by shared energetic resonance
Capacity-based responsibility requires compatibility of being
Restoration logic operates through harmonious association
Consciousness alignment determines lawful relational engagement
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent A performs dharma THEN A SHALL NOT require validation from misaligned agents
IF two entities engage in relational contract THEN their vyavahara MUST reflect samya (equivalence)
IF mismatched capacities interact THEN automatic dissolution protocol activates
IF vivaha occurs THEN both parties MUST demonstrate parity in consciousness maturity
IF alignment diverges post-contract THEN reintegration process initiates without penalty
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this verse establishes that legal recognition of unions or agreements depends upon demonstrated parity of consciousness maturity between involved parties. Misalignment invalidates the foundational basis for judicial enforcement unless realignment is achieved.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramana-based causality indicates that disharmony stems from incompatible levels of awareness. Anupurvasah reveals that consequences unfold naturally when alignment is absent. Proportional responsibility lies in choosing congruent relationships. The non-punitive reality rule affirms that separation occurs organically where unity cannot sustain.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate consciousness calibration session between parties
Deploy vyavahara realignment matrix to assess energetic compatibility
Reintroduce dharma-based conduct framework to restore parity
Establish ongoing alignment monitoring without punitive oversight
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands executed: relational harmony flows from conscious equivalence; divergence dissolves by natural law; restoration prevails through觉醒 alignment; Dharma is hereby affirmed as self-regulating, non-punitive, and consciousness-ordained.
